quotes.quote: People say that age is just a state of mind. I say it's more about the state of your body.
Age is an issue of mind over matter. If you don't mind, it doesn't matter.
In youth we learn; in age we understand.
Age does not depend upon years, but upon temperament and health. Some men are born old, and some never grow up.
Age is not a particularly interesting subject. Anyone can get old. All you have to do is live long enough.
Age is like the newest version of a software   it has a bunch of great new features but you lost all the cool features the original version had.
Wisdom doesn't necessarily come with age. Sometimes age just shows up all by itself.
At age 20, we worry about what others think of us. At age 40, we don't care what they think of us. At age 60, we discover they haven't been thinking of us at all.

A man's age is something impressive, it sums up his life: maturity reached slowly and against many obstacles, illnesses cured, griefs and despairs overcome, and unconscious risks taken; maturity formed through so many desires, hopes, regrets, forgotten things, loves. A man's age represents a fine cargo of experiences and memories.
Age does not make us childish, as some say it only finds us true children still.
Age is no barrier. It's a limitation you put on your mind.
Age is of no importance unless you are a cheese.
Age is just a number. It's totally irrelevant unless, of course, you happen to be a bottle of wine.
Age carries all things away even the mind.
Sometimes age succeeds, sometimes it fails. It depends on you.
Age swallows our childhood.
Age is a matter of feeling...not of years.
Age is wisdom if one has lived ones life properly.
Age is information failure. The body loses fluency.
Age is foolish and forgetful when it underestimates youth.
Age is a very high price to pay for maturity.
Age is whatever you think it is. You are as old as you think you are.
Age is getting to know all the ways the world turns, so that if you cannot turn the world the way you want, you can at least, get out of the way so you won't get run over.
I believe the true function of age is memory. I'm recording as fast as I can.
Age should not have its face lifted, but it should rather teach the world to admire wrinkles as the etchings of experience and the firm line of character.
Youth is the gift of nature, but age is a work of art.
I don't look my age, I don't feel my age and I don't act my age. To me age is just a number.
Age imprints more wrinkles in the mind than it does on the face.
Age has been the perfect fire extinguisher for flaming youth.
The wiser mind mourns less for what age takes away than what it leaves behind.
He who is of a calm and happy nature will hardly feel the pressure of age, but to him who is of an opposite disposition, youth and age are equally a burden.
Age does not protect you from love, but love to some extent protects you from age.
No matter what your age you can be great.
Age appears to be best in four things, - old wood best to burn, old wine to drink, old friends to trust, and old authors to read.
Count your blessings for your age, as there are many who never get the opportunity.
Age does not diminish the extreme disappointment of having a scoop of ice cream fall from the cone.
Age is no guarantee of maturity.
Age does not matter if the matter does not age.
Age attacks when we least expect it.
The surest sign of age is loneliness.
Age is like love, it cannot be hid
Age is how we determine how valuable you are.
Age is just the amount of time that you have been on earth, what really matters is where you are going after your time is up.
Age is simply the number of years the world has enjoyed you!
Your age does not define you, you define your age.
Live your life and forget your age.
Sometimes age succeeds, sometimes it fails. It depends on you.
Count your age by friends, not years. Count your life by smiles, not tears.
A man is not old until regrets take the place of dreams.
Aging is not lost youth but a new stage of opportunity and strength.
When grace is joined with wrinkles, it is adorable. There is an unspeakable dawn in happy old age.
Some age. Others mature.
Nobody grows old merely by living a number of years. We grow old by deserting our ideals. Years may wrinkle the skin, but to give up enthusiasm wrinkles the soul.
There's no such thing as old age, there is only sorrow.
We turn not older with years but newer every day.
The age of a woman doesn't mean a thing. The best tunes are played on the oldest fiddles.
A graceful and honorable old age is the childhood of immortality.
Age, that lessens the enjoyment of life, increases our desire of living
Age considers. Youth ventures.
Age either transfigures or petrifies.
Age, like woman, requires fit surroundings.
Age affects how people experience time.
Age whitens hairs, but not sin.
Age before beauty, and pearls before swine.
Age and treachery will overcome youth and skill.
Age wrinkles the body. Quitting wrinkles the soul.
Age is a slowing down of everything except fear.
Age isn't how old you are but how old you feel.
Age appears to be best in four things. Old wood best to burn, old wine to drink, old friends to trust, and old authors to read.
Middle age is youth without levity, and age without decay.
Old age isn't so bad when you consider the alternative.
Youth and age touch only the surface of our lives.
Old age is the most unexpected of all things that happen to a man.
Age is not all decay. It is the ripening, the swelling, of the fresh life within, that withers and bursts the husk.
What our age lacks is not reflection, but passion.
Age is rarely despised but when it is, contemptible.
Age is such a natural progression you shouldn't fight it.
